Description: Upper body sherd of East Greek Black Polychrome pottery dinos; interior; glazed at least at top (worn); exterior: glazed, with frieze of tongues, alternating added white, black, and added red; below, lines in added white and red.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Probably from the same vase as 26.2.80.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 38, pl. 23, no. 17)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1118)
